page.title: 09Uppingham by-pass,Rutland
page.content: The Uppingham By-pass skirts the old historic market town from East to West.Its length of just under three kilometers cuts through agricultural land used predominantly for cattle grazing.It is a single carriageway road with no barrier down the middle.Half way along there is a roundabout linking an access road into Uppingham,the by-pass,and two roads running northwards. A traffic survey was carried out between{3.50 p. m. and 4.20 p. m. } on{24th October 1985.}The total number of vehicles approaching the A47/A6003 roundabout from the eastern part of the by-pass was 142, the majority cars and vans but including 33 Heavy Goods Vehicles. In each ten minute period there were 41, 39 and 29 cars, vans or motor cycles.
